title: Is Karma a disruptive bursty battle-artillery enchanter?
body:
I've just read Riot's new [Dev Blog about classes and subclasses](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/gameplay/dev-blog-classes-subclasses) (check it out, there's a Vlad teaser in it :)!). Since I am always interested in game design, I was eager to read what Riot had to write and then, just for fun, tried to find out, where Karma would fit in. And it left me really confused. Obviously, she is a mage, so she could be a:

* Burstmage {{champion:99}} {{champion:45}} 
* Battlemage {{champion:30}} {{champion:8}} 
* Artillery mage {{champion:115}} {{champion:101}} 
* Enchanter {{champion:117}} {{champion:40}} 
* Disruptor {{champion:34}} {{champion:143}} 

Since in terms of design, she is supposed to be close to Lux, let's see if she fits the **Burstmages** description:

> _Burst Mages aim to single out vulnerable targets by locking them down and following up with a devastating barrage of damage from range. Burst Mages struggle heavily against beefier targets who can shrug off their initial spike of damage._

So, Karma has troubles with beefier targets and she can deal devastating damage from range.... but to lock down, she has to cuddle for a while and what she does really isn't a _"barrage"_ either. Besides, she has short cooldowns, so maybe she is a **Battlemage**?`

> _Battle Mages get into the middle of the fray, seeking to wreak havoc upon the entire enemy team with their overwhelming sustained area damage. Due to their relatively short (but not melee) combat ranges and the need to burn down their opponents over time, Battle Mages have significant defensive capabilities that range from sustaining endlessly to literally defying death for a short period of time._

Karma seems to have really good defensive capabilities, and one could argue that her RW lets her defy death pretty well,.... but she doesn't exactly have _"overwhelming sustained area damage"_. Soooo..... maybe her RQ qualifies her for **Artillery Mages**?

> _Artillery Mages are the masters of range, and they leverage that advantage to whittle down their opponents over time from great distances. In turn, Artillery Mages are severely punished when enemies finally succeed in closing in on them, due to their extreme fragility and limited mobility._

Well, she _does_ wittle down enemies from afar, it's just not really _great_ distances. She also seems to have troubles when being closed on, but significantly less than other mages. 

So this isn't getting us anywhere. How about Lulu/Janna, who Karma is frequently compared to. Can she share their **"Enchanter"** subclass?

> _Enchanters focus on amplifying their allies’ effectiveness by directly augmenting them and defending them from incoming threats. Enchanters themselves are often quite fragile and bring relatively low damage to the table, meaning they really only shine when grouped together with others._

Her E and RE would fit this, as Karma profits from lategame teamfights, in which she can shield everyone and defend allies from incoming threats. However, is Karma's damage _"relatively low"_? I wouldn't dare to say. She also doesn't directly amplify her allies' effectiveness, like Lulu's & Janna's shields do. So, what about the last category? Zyra is another mage support, in the end.... can Karma be a **Disruptor**?

> _Disruptors specialize in locking down opponents or, in some cases, entire battlefields by creating intense zones of threat that only foolish enemies would dare wade through. Although not as reliant on their friends as Enchanters, the fragile and immobile Disruptors greatly benefit from allied presence - both to deter incoming danger and to help capitalize on targets they’ve locked down._

Well, Karma's RQ kiiiiiind of creates a zone of threat. Karma also isn't as _reliant_ on allies, while still profiting from allies, who she can lock targets down for with RW.... but then again, she really can't easily or reliably create those zones and her lockdown and damage zones exclude each other. Compared to Zyra/Anivia she has no reliable lockdown and can AT BEST only lock down one target, slowly and unreliably.

> # **So what is Karma? And does it matter?**

Maybe not. Riot did say, that these are **_"more a set of guidelines than rigid rules"_** and it is very likely - or even better - if some champions explore the outskirts of those subclasses, while maybe crossing over to another subclass. So having champions who don't clearly fit one of those is to be expected.

But in terms of design it seems VERY concerning to me, that this champion falls awkwardly over five outskirts AT ONCE. This, to me, indicates a very strong confusion of roles and a HEAVY disconnect with Riot's current understanding of champion design. So, are the subclasses not good enough to describe Karma, or is Karma so far removed from fitting a role, that it explodes Riot's terminology? And is this a problem?

I am interested in what you think. And in what Riot thinks, but I don't eally expect an answer.
Let's discuss :)!

replies.body: Battlemage, secondary in enchanter. Her low cooldown Q means that she is constantly peppering the enemy with magic damage and her shields enable her allies to accomplish whatever they need to, which her slows and snares also help her peel enemies and set up picks.

We're still talking about Karma too, Battle Mage/Enchanter hybrid is the current front runner for us too though. It's not a perfect description, but these class definitions are intended to be ways of assessing champions, not rigid 'here's what a champion has to be' rules or anything.
If you give back her shield bomb she'd feel even more like a Battle Mage/Enchanter ;)

But she does have the meaningful strengths and weaknesses you'd expect from that class definition.

She can't really burst or lock down targets, but she deals a solid amount of damage over time and provide enough light cc for kiting. Her range isn't amazing but she has tools that allow her to take a hit and protect herself. And on top of that her RE is a hugely powerful enabler for her team.

How can you say she has meaningful strengths and weaknesses and then talk about so many things where she clearly isn't strong or weak anywhere? 

**Burst**? I guess.
**Lockdown**? Some
**Damage over time?** Fairly
**Sustain**? You could say so.
**Mobility**? Well, she isn't completely immobile.
**Range**? Not amazing but there
**Disengage**? Soft, but not horrible
**Waveclear**? Decent to "meh"
**Tankyness**? For a _mage_ it's good
**Teamprotection**? Kinda better than having Locket/Talisman

I mean, seriously, she is so _all over the place_, that 70% of people agree she falls in all possible categories, while all categories were individually selected at least once. This is because people can't properly assign her pros/cons to any subclass.

That does not make Karma into a burst mage. She does not have much kill potential on targets unless she gets a snare off so she can guarantee the second hit of RQ, which means her "burst" is a 3 second long ordeal fraught with counterplay opportunities, that is not a burst pattern.
If you use up all your damagespells in 3s with a huge spike in it, it's burst (counterplay is a nonfactor). Karma's RQ clearly shows a burstmage pattern, whereas the rest of her kit doesn't.
I could swear I hear a toilet flush every time I finish reading one of his comments. I'm convinced he's just trolling tbh.

I sometimes check what he has to say on other subjects. He doesn't seem to provoke on purpose there. So either he is just trolling Karma topics (for whatever reason) or, what seems more likely, just isn't that bright (or simply missinformed) but very confident nonetheless.

He said she has no burst as if Q/RQ doesn't exist and no lockdown like she doesn't have 3s+ root. He's being contrary for the sake of it.

I think she has strengths and weaknesses in that she is basically a kite mage who has to stay just at arms reach to do what she wants to do, and has some tools to help her in it.  Although maybe she is intended to be a generalist mage, which while not necessarily exciting in terms of design as some of these class descriptions, it is kinda cool to have someone who can adapt and do a bit of each.

I guess this has been her problem for a while now, she does too much.
She has battle mage features, artillery features and enchanter features with a dash of disrupter features.

I wonder how karma players would feel about having some of that power trimmed? perhaps her most defining feature is that she doesnt fit into a single class and is leagues premiere generalist mage?
I think it would be cool to have at least someone be "the generalist mage" whether thats karma or not is up for debate but its a cool outlier role for someone to fill.
I actually think that she is a really good candidate, her mantra can lock her power away so that she can perform decently at a number of roles but only 1 at a time.

I disagree that she has any Artillery features, her longer range is RQ, and it's not that long compared to Velkoz or Xerath or Ziggs. 

On the other hand, she has a hint of Battle Mage, with her effective range, but I think she lacks the raw power of the others cited in this category (Vlad/Swain).

As I said above, for me she's an Enchanter/Disruptor. Which one exactly isn't clear, but she's right in the middle of the Controller super-class.

True, i keep thinking her mantrad Q has longer range, i guess we could see her focused more to the battle mage enchanter/disrupter side of things...

Agree, these are the two that fit her the most.

Artillery are supposed to have very long range but be very fragile up close - that's not Karma.  She relies on low-cooldown medium-range poke - that's a Battle Mage.
The rest of her kit fits in the Enchanter category, with some elements of Disruptor.

But neither a battlemage, nor an enchanter should have the long range burst/poke, that her RQ provides.
Ryze, Cass and Vlad don't have that for a reason. 
Neither do Nami, Janna, Lulu. 

Should her RQ be reworked to fit those two roles better?

she has the most generic weird kit in the game.

If Karma doesn't qualify as an enchanter - which with the damage she currently has, she does not - she will probably be left out too.
